column4: Something odd is going on with my dvd burner, no matter what disk I put in, it tells me it's a bad disk.
This is frustrating... my hard drive is full and I can't get ntfs write or CD burning to work.
I did.  the external drive doesn't show up when I run ntfs-config.
install ntfs-config.. it'll let you control how the ntfs partition is mounted
I did. The external drive doesn't show up when I run ntfs-config.
wierd.. unmount it and remount it with the ntfs-3g driver
i'm guessing you just don't mount the ntfs partition with write support but you have the drivers to do that
How do I remount it with the ntfs-3g driver?  That is, am I supposed to see it in ntfs-config then, or do I need to edit /etc/mtab?
it's better to put it in /etc/mtab
i thought you should put it in /etc/fstab
but i'm not that geeky to know
Yeah, sorry, mtab is generated automagically IRRC.
also, make sure you turn off windows by shutting it down.. if you don't follow the right procedure for shutting down windows, it'll be hard to mount the ntfs partition on linux
